text: 4:03 PM. It's a cool autumn afternoon. The chilly breeze of the outside air is shut behind you as you enter the dimly lit office building
You check the time. 4:04. Seems like you're 4 minutes late to your appointment.
The clock ticks. It is now 4:05. You don't hear anything from the office
The office is as cold as it was outside, though in an oddly comfortable way
Good afternoon!
No need to be *stressed*, good friend. Have a seat! Make yourself at home!
Aren't you *excited*! You look like someone that I'd like to meet! Take a seat!
Anything caught your *interest*, my curious compadre? Nevermind, have a seat!
Very well. Let me check the time. Alright. Let's get to it then.
So tell me, what has been troubling you lately? I understand that your reason of visit is under "nightmares". Would you like to talk about that?
Interesting that you speak of the mind. The mind is, after all, our only compass of reality. "Je pense, donc je suis"! Who's to say our dreams are so different from reality?
Interesting that you speak of the mind. I did *not* take you for someone who is troubled with *stress*.

How brave of you, mocking the face of controversy! Do you imply that the workings of the mind are at the effect of our surroundings? Or do you question the true reality of our dreams? This, I must know more.
I don't believe you understand what you're saying. Are you implying that your nightmares are beyond the realm of your mind? Please *focus* on what I'm saying here
Anywho, I think you're quite the intriguing fellow. Whatever your belief, your nightmares will reveal to me either your mind or your universe. And either way, I will be eager to learn
How disappointing. Alas, even I am a flawed philosopher
Oh ho, getting quite *excited* now, aren't we? Let us question the free will of ourselves on a later time. Explain to me, please, your nightmares.
Well, since you're *interested*, let's talk a bit more about that. Perhaps I'm being a bit of a devil's advocate, but allow me to explain.

Do you ask due to curiousity, or are you simply asking to appear more cunning? Here's a question. Why is a *lack* of *focus* is so easy to observe. It's because people are not even focusing on hiding it!
Well, since you're *interested*, let's talk a bit more about that. Perhaps I'm being a bit of a devil's advocate, but allow me to explain.
Anywho, perhaps I am simply misjudging you. A dull universe does not always allude to a dull mind. As well as vice versa, I would say.
You know, I've faced many cases regarding nightmares before: some professional, and some closer to home. And I'm always keen to observe this one detail when it comes to nightmares...

Who are we to lie to ourselves of our fate? Is it not true that our minds, though so treasured by ourselves, can be ultimately reduced to chemicals and memories: both of which are reactants of our universe?
Alas, you have really crushed my spirit. I shall not bore myself with petty conversation. Let us get on with our business
What do we truly know about the mind? Is it not true that our senses deceive us? You suffer from nightmares, surely you're familiar with that. And so, how can we make sense of our universe...

In nightmares, as well as dreams, we act without logic; often without even consciousness, to the point in which we are unaware what we are doing. And so, I must ask you, do you think you are really you when you are dreaming?
If nothing can be proven?
Spoken like a stoic, my cheerful compadre. Well, since you are so sure of yourself, I shall leave this debate to rest. Lets us begin discussing the nightmares
How *engaging* this discussion has been. You're quite the Aristotle, my amiable amigo. But enough petty debate. Lets us begin discussing the nightmares
